assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets include no report of an Iranian boarding/seizure of a merchant vessel near the Strait of Hormuz, nor any confirmation from UKMTO, U.S. Navy/CENTCOM, or a flag state.
No item in today’s news mentions a Lloyd’s Joint War Committee Listed Areas update or any expansion explicitly covering the Strait of Hormuz/adjacent waters.

The Cuba-related headline concerns Guatemala ending use of Cuban doctors; it does not indicate airlines suspending/reducing Cuba routes due to jet-fuel/refueling constraints, and no such airline announcements appear in today’s bullets.
None of today’s bullets report Alphabet/Google bond issuance, let alone aggregate gross issuance totaling at least $15B.
No Alphabet earnings release/call or SEC filing is referenced in today’s bullets announcing a new incremental share repurchase authorization of at least $70B.
Today’s bullets do not mention OpenAI/ChatGPT launching an advertiser onboarding pathway (help-center documentation, sign-up form, or self-serve dashboard) for ChatGPT ads.
No reporting in today’s bullets indicates Databricks has filed (confidentially or publicly) an IPO registration statement (S-1/F-1) with the U.S. SEC.

A MarketWatch item references a 'prediction-market super cycle' in the context of Robinhood, but there is no clear evidence of a specific state attorney general or state gaming regulator issuing a public cease-and-desist/order/enforcement notice targeting sports-event prediction markets.
No item indicates the U.S. House has passed a bill expanding LIHTC via a ≥10% 9% allocation increase or making the 4% floor permanent.
Today’s bullets do not mention a NATO summit communiqué or Secretary General statement endorsing a new minimum defense-spending benchmark of at least 2.5% of GDP.
